Class Order

java.lang.Object
Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Order>, OrderInterface
public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
implements OrderInterface, java.lang.Comparable<Order>
This class represents an order from the beverage shop. The Order has a Customer and one or more Beverages. The Order class implements OrderInterface and Comparable.
Version:
1, 05/08/2021
Author:
Jessica Bunting

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Customer cust
    The Customer placing the order
    private java.util.ArrayList<Beverage> orderBevs
    An ArrayList of Beverage objects
    private DAY orderDay
    The day of the week the order is placed
    private int orderNo
    The order number, from 10000 to 90000
    private int orderTime
    The time of day the order is placed

    • getBeverage

      public Beverage getBeverage​(int itemNo)
      Description copied from interface: OrderInterface
      returns the beverage listed in the itemNo of the order, for example if itemNo is 0 this method will return the first beverage in the order Note: this method returns the shallow copy of the Beverage
      Specified by:
      getBeverage in interface OrderInterface
      Returns:
      the beverage listed in the itemNo of the order or null if there is no item in the order

    • addNewBeverage

      public void addNewBeverage​(java.lang.String bevName, SIZE size, boolean extraShot, boolean extraSyrup)
      Description copied from interface: OrderInterface
      adds coffee order to this order
      Specified by:
      addNewBeverage in interface OrderInterface
      Parameters:
      bevName - beverage name
      size - beverage size of type SIZE
      extraShot - true if the coffee beverage has extra shot , false otherwise
      extraSyrup - true if the coffee beverage has extra syrup , false otherwise

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Order ord)
      Compares this order with another order based on the order number. Returns 0 if this order number is same as another order's order number, 1 if it is greater than another order's order number, -1 if it smaller than another order's order number.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Order>
      Returns:
      0 if this order number is same as another order's order number, 1 if it is greater than another order's order number, -1 if it smaller than another order's order number.
